articles.description: A pending framework agreement between Ottawa and Alberta to build an oil pipeline will not prompt Steven Guilbeault, a former Greenpeace activist, to quit Mark Carney's cabinet.

articles.title: Study finds untreated sleep apnea doubles Parkinson’s risk
articles.description: A massive veteran study found a strong connection between untreated sleep apnea and a higher chance of Parkinson’s. CPAP users had much lower odds of developing the condition. Researchers believe that repeated dips in oxygen during sleep may strain neurons over time. The results suggest that better

articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.description: Calgary is in a housing crunch, and two commentators from the Fraser Institute recently argued in these pages that blanket upzoning is essential to making new homes “faster and cheaper.” It’s a tidy theory. articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

articles.title: Ethiopian volcano erupts for first time in 12,000 years
articles.description: Ash clouds from Hayli Gubbi volcano sent drifting across the Red Sea toward Yemen and OmanA volcano in Ethiopia’s north-eastern region has erupted for the first time in nearly 12,000 years, sending thick plumes of smoke up to 9 miles (14km) into the sky, and across the Red Sea toward Yemen and Oman.

articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

articles.description: HONG KONG (AP) — Hong Kong firefighters were making a final push to try and find any survivors from the city’s worst fire in memory, going apartment-to-apartment in the high-rise complex in an exhaustive search. articles.title: Oil in Worst Monthly Run Since 2023 With OPEC+, Ukraine in Focus
articles.description: Oil headed for the longest run of monthly losses in more than two years, as traders looked ahead to an OPEC+ meeting this weekend and gauged US-led efforts to end the conflict in Ukraine.

articles.description: Aman says it will take 'all available measures' to stop its citizens from being recruited to fight for Russian forces.

articles.title: STM maintenance workers set to begin overtime strike in December
articles.description: Montreal commuters could see disruptions soon, Société de transport de Montréal (STM) maintenance workers might skip extra hours starting next month. articles.title: Trump says US will stop Venezuelan drug trafficking ‘by land’ soon
articles.description: US president claims attacks on vessels in Latin American region have stopped 85 percent of drugs trafficked by sea.

articles.title: Petrobras Trims Five-Year Plan to $109 Billion on Low Prices
articles.description: Brazilian oil major Petrobras announced a 2% decrease in its next five-year investment plan to $109 billion in a move to shield its cash flow at a time of lower international oil prices.
